sect1.title: Selecting exercises
sect1.para: Selecting exercises works like navigating a web page and clicking on links. Press AltLeft to move to the previous page or F5 to move to the front page.

sect2.title: Searching for exercises
sect2.para: The front page has a search bar that let you search for exercises whose title matches you search string. Just fill in a word or two, for example Seventh and press Enter or click Search to see all exercises that has the work Seventh in its title.
The program will first assume you are searching in your own language, and will list all exerises matching. Then it will take you search term and search in the untranslated lesson titles.

Using the search bar on the front page will search all exercises that are added to this front page, and its sub pages. If you want to search all exercises avalable to Solfege, you should press CtrlF5.

sect2.title: Searching for exercise modules
sect2.para: To search for exercises written using a specific exercise module, you have to enter module:modulename. You can also add words to search for. Example: module:idbyname major
